![](../images/epid_logo.png){.absolute bottom=0 right=50 width="400" height="100"} # Today's Theme {.imgslide} Mental models, past and present (or at least recent past...) ## Agenda - Chronicling the end of the Golden Square outbreak - Bringing lessons from *The Ghost Map* into the present. - Starting to construct a comprehensive mental model of your pathogen. ## What do you think the implications of this (very) short story are for us? :::{.r-stack} ![](../images/borges_exactitude.png){.fragment width=1000} ![](../images/exactitude_in_science.jpeg){.fragment} ::: ## The last days of the Broad Street Outbreak - What evidence began to convince Henry Whitehead of the contamination theory? - What were the conclusions of the Vestry Committee on the cause of the outbreak? What may have kept them from adopting Snow's theory? - What was the likely impact of the removal of the pump handle on the trajectory of the outbreak? - What possible preventive effects did removing the handle have? Why? ## What's old is new... In this paper, I have argued that both the long delays in replacing flawed, miasma-driven approaches to cholera prevention in the nineteenth century and long delays in replacing an exclusively contact-and-droplet model of SARS-CoV-2 prevention with one that includes airborne transmission in the twenty-first had a philosophical explanation in terms of which mental models of reality prevailed and the extent to which scientists and policymakers favoured data over theory. (Greenhalgh 2021) ## Well thought-out mental models let us:
  • Characterize meaningful relationships between physical environments, social environments, and health.
  • Reveal the appropriate scale of analysis and intervention.
  • Explore the implications of geographically varying policies.
    • ## Mental models are intuition pumps :::{.columns} :::{.column width=50%} As described by the philosopher Daniel Dennett: > Intuition pumps are cunningly designed [thought experiments, which] focus the reader's attention on "the important" features, and...deflect the reader from bogging down in hard-to-follow details. (From Dennett, 1984) ::: :::{.column width=50%} ![A not-so-metaphorical intuition pump](../images/broad_street_pump.jpg) ::: ::: ## Why are mental models so critical to how we understand and intervene in epidemics? - What is evidence-based medicine, and what is Greenhalgh's critique of its role in the COVID-19 pandemic? - How does Peter Medawar characterize the relationships between theory and data in science? - Specifically, what weaknesses does she highlight in the Danamask RCT? - What alternative sources of evidence does she argue should have been considered sooner? ## Small scale data provided compelling evidence for the droplet theory of SARS-CoV-2 transmission {.imgslide} Does this echo anything from *The Ghost Map*? ## Why didn't mechanistic evidence dislodge the droplet-only perspective on SARS-CoV-2 transmission? {.imgslide} Relationship between voice volume and aerosol production (From [Asadi et al. 2019](https://www.nature.com/articles/s41598-019-38808-z)) ## EBM's hierarchy of evidence :::{.columns} :::{.column width=50%} - What is meant by 'risk of bias'? - Quality of evidence? - Where would Snow's explorations fit in this hierarchy? ::: :::{.column width=50%} ![A version of the 'evidence pyramid' central to the philosophy of evidence-based medicine](../images/ebm_evidence_pyramid.png) ::: ::: ## Two ways of aggregating evidence :::{.columns} :::{.column width=50%} :::{.r-stack} :::{.fragment .fade-out fragment-index=1} ![Brick Wall: Collecting similar forms of evidence to test the strength of a hypothesis](../images/brick_wall.jpeg){width=500} ::: :::{.fragment .fade-in fragment-index=1} ![](../images/Kool_Wall_Bust.gif){width=700} ::: ::: ::: :::{.column width=50%} ![Stone Wall: Collecting heterogeneous evidence to develop a robust and comprehensive explanation](../images/old_stone_wall.jpeg) ::: ::: ## Building up mental models for your pathogen projects using concept maps {.imgslide} Another way of [thinking through the implications of what we've read](https://miro.com/app/board/uXjVPTSQ80M=/).
